info.title: Fitbit Web API
info.description: Fitbit provides a Web API for accessing data from Fitbit activity trackers, Aria scale, and manually entered logs. Anyone can develop an application to access and modify a Fitbit user's data on their behalf, so long as it complies with Fitbit Platform Terms of Service. These Swagger UI docs do not currently support making Fitbit API requests directly. In order to make a request, construct a request for the appropriate endpoint using this documentation, and then add an Authorization header to each request with an access token obtained using the steps outlined here: https://dev.fitbit.com/build/reference/web-api/oauth2/#obtaining-consent.

post.description: Retrieves an OAuth 2 access token.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The Authorization header must be set to 'Basic' followed by a space, then the Base64 encoded string of your application's client id and secret concatenated with a colon. For example, 'Basic Y2xpZW50X2lkOmNsaWVudCBzZWNyZXQ='. The Base64 encoded string, 'Y2xpZW50X2lkOmNsaWVudCBzZWNyZXQ=', is decoded as 'client_id:client secret'.

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: Authorization code received in the redirect as URI parameter. Required if using the Authorization Code flow.

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description: This is your Fitbit API application id from your settings on dev.fitbit.com.

parameters.name: expires_in
parameters.description: Specify the desired access token lifetime. Defaults to 28800 for 8 hours. The other valid value is 3600 for 1 hour.

parameters.name: grant_type
parameters.description: Authorization grant type. Valid values are 'authorization_code' and 'refresh_token'.

parameters.name: redirect_uri
parameters.description: Uri to which the access token will be sent if the request is successful. Required if specified in the redirect to the authorization page. Must be exact match.

parameters.name: refresh_token
parameters.description: Refresh token issued by Fitbit. Required if 'grant_type' is 'refresh_token'.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Required if specified in the redirect uri of the authorization page. Must be an exact match.

400.description: The request had bad syntax or was inherently impossible to be satisfied.

401.description: Authentication was unsuccessful due to invalid client credentials.

409.description: Request conflict due to multiple clients attempting to refresh the same access token.

post.summary: Retrieve the active state of an OAuth 2.0 token
post.description: Retrieves the active state of an OAuth 2.0 token. It follows https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7662.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: OAuth 2.0 token to retrieve the state of

400.description: The request had bad syntax or was inherently impossible to be satisfied.

401.description: Authentication was unsuccessful due to invalid client credentials.

409.description: Request conflict due to multiple clients

post.description: The Log Activity endpoint creates log entry for an activity or user's private custom activity using units in the unit system which corresponds to the Accept-Language header provided (or using optional custom distanceUnit) and get a response in the format requested.

parameters.name: activityId
parameters.description: The ID of the activity, directory activity or intensity level activity.

parameters.name: activityName
parameters.description: Custom activity name. Either activityId or activityName must be provided.

parameters.name: manualCalories
parameters.description: Calories burned that are manaully specified. Required with activityName must be provided.

parameters.name: startTime
parameters.description: Activity start time. Hours and minutes in the format HH:mm:ss.

parameters.name: durationMillis
parameters.description: Duration in milliseconds.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Log entry date in the format yyyy-MM-dd.

parameters.name: distance
parameters.description: Distance is required for logging directory activity in the format X.XX and in the selected distanceUnit.

parameters.name: distanceUnit
parameters.description: Distance measurement unit. Steps units are available only for Walking (activityId=90013) and Running (activityId=90009) directory activities and their intensity levels.

400.description: The request had bad syntax or was inherently impossible to be satified.

409.description: Returned if the given user is already subscribed to this stream using a different subscription ID, OR if the given subscription ID is already used to identify a subscription to a different stream.

get.description: Retreives a list of user's activity log entries before or after a given day with offset and limit using units in the unit system which corresponds to the Accept-Language header provided.

parameters.name: beforeDate
parameters.description: The date in the format yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss. Only yyyy-MM-dd is required. Either beforeDate or afterDate should be specified.

parameters.name: afterDate
parameters.description: The date in the format yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The sort order of entries by date asc (ascending) or desc (descending).

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset number of entries.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of entries returned (maximum;100).

post.description: Adds the alarm settings to a given ID for a given device.

parameters.name: tracker-id
parameters.description: The ID of the tracker for which data is returned. The tracker-id value is found via the Get Devices endpoint.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: Time of day that the alarm vibrates with a UTC timezone offset, e.g. 07:15-08:00.

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: true or false. If false, alarm does not vibrate until enabled is set to true.

parameters.name: recurring
parameters.description: true or false. If false, the alarm is a single event.

parameters.name: weekDays
parameters.description: Comma separated list of days of the week on which the alarm vibrates, e.g. MONDAY, TUESDAY.

parameters.name: calories
parameters.description: Calories for this serving size. This is allowed with foodName parameter (default to zero); otherwise it is ignored.

get.summary: Get Heart Rate Intraday Time Series
get.description: Returns the intraday time series for a given resource in the format requested. If your application has the appropriate access, your calls to a time series endpoint for a specific day (by using start and end dates on the same day or a period of 1d), the response will include extended intraday values with a one-minute detail level for that day. Unlike other time series calls that allow fetching data of other users, intraday data is available only for and to the authorized user.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: The date in the format of yyyy-MM-dd or today.

parameters.name: end-date
parameters.description: The end date in the format of yyyy-MM-dd or today.

parameters.name: detail-level
parameters.description: The number of data points to include either 1sec or 1min.

403.description: The server understood the request, but is refusing to fulfill it.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The sort order of entries by date asc (ascending) or desc (descending).

get.description: Retreives a list of a user's subscriptions for your application in the format requested. You can either fetch subscriptions for a specific collection or the entire list of subscriptions for the user. For best practice, make sure that your application maintains this list on your side and use this endpoint only to periodically ensure data consistency.

parameters.name: collection-path
parameters.description: This is the resource of the collection to receive notifications from (foods, activities, sleep, or body). If not present, subscription will be created for all collections. If you have both all and specific collection subscriptions, you will get duplicate notifications on that collections' updates. Each subscriber can have only one subscription for a specific user's collection.

200.description: Returned if the given user is already subscribed to the stream.

201.description: Returned if a new subscription was created in response to your request.

409.description: Returned if the given user is already subscribed to this stream using a different subscription ID, OR if the given subscription ID is already used to identify a subscription to a different stream.

post.description: Adds a subscription in your application so that users can get notifications and return a response in the format requested. The subscription-id value provides a way to associate an update with a particular user stream in your application.

parameters.name: collection-path
parameters.description: This is the resource of the collection to receive notifications from (foods, activities, sleep, or body). If not present, subscription will be created for all collections. If you have both all and specific collection subscriptions, you will get duplicate notifications on that collections' updates. Each subscriber can have only one subscription for a specific user's collection.

parameters.name: subscription-id
parameters.description: This is the unique ID of the subscription created by the API client application. Each ID must be unique across the entire set of subscribers and collections. The Fitbit servers will pass this ID back along with any notifications about the user indicated by the user parameter in the URL path.

200.description: Returned if the given user is already subscribed to the stream.

201.description: Returned if a new subscription was created in response to your request.

409.description: Returned if the given user is already subscribed to this stream using a different subscription ID, OR if the given subscription ID is already used to identify a subscription to a different stream.

delete.description: Deletes a subscription for a user..

parameters.name: collection-path
parameters.description: This is the resource of the collection to receive notifications from (foods, activities, sleep, or body). If not present, subscription will be created for all collections. If you have both all and specific collection subscriptions, you will get duplicate notifications on that collections' updates. Each subscriber can have only one subscription for a specific user's collection.

parameters.name: subscription-id
parameters.description: This is the resource of the collection to receive notifications from (foods, activities, sleep, or body). If not present, subscription will be created for all collections. If you have both all and specific collection subscriptions, you will get duplicate notifications on that collections' updates. Each subscriber can have only one subscription for a specific user's collection.

201.description: Returned if a new subscription was created in response to your request.

409.description: Returned if the given user is already subscribed to this stream using a different subscription ID, OR if the given subscription ID is already used to identify a subscription to a different stream.

get.description: Retrieves the user's badges in the format requested. Response includes all badges for the user as seen on the Fitbit website badge locker (both activity and weight related.) The endpoint returns weight and distance badges based on the user's unit profile preference as on the website.

201.description: Returned if a new subscription was created in response to your request.

409.description: Returned if the given user is already subscribed to this stream using a different subscription ID, OR if the given subscription ID is already used to identify a subscription to a different stream.

get.description: Returns a user's profile. The authenticated owner receives all values. However, the authenticated user's access to other users' data is subject to those users' privacy settings. Numerical values are returned in the unit system specified in the Accept-Language header.

201.description: Returned if a new subscription was created in response to your request.

409.description: Returned if the given user is already subscribed to this stream using a different subscription ID, OR if the given subscription ID is already used to identify a subscription to a different stream.

post.description: Updates a user's profile using a form.

parameters.name: gender
parameters.description: The sex of the user; (MALE/FEMALE/NA).

parameters.name: birthday
parameters.description: The date of birth in the format of yyyy-MM-dd.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: The height in the format X.XX in the unit system that corresponds to the Accept-Language header provided.

parameters.name: aboutMe
parameters.description: This is a short description of user.

parameters.name: fullname
parameters.description: The fullname of the user.

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: The country of the user's residence. This is a two-character code.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: The US state of the user's residence. This is a two-character code if the country was or is set to US.

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: The US city of the user's residence.

parameters.name: strideLengthWalking
parameters.description: Walking stride length in the format X.XX, where it is in the unit system that corresponds to the Accept-Language header provided.

parameters.name: strideLengthRunning
parameters.description: Running stride length in the format X.XX, where it is in the unit system that corresponds to the Accept-Language header provided.

parameters.name: weightUnit
parameters.description: Default weight unit on website (which doesn't affect API); one of (en_US, en_GB, 'any' for METRIC).

parameters.name: heightUnit
parameters.description: Default height/distance unit on website (which doesn't affect API); one of (en_US, en_GB, 'any' for METRIC).

parameters.name: waterUnit
parameters.description: Default water unit on website (which doesn't affect API); one of (en_US, en_GB, 'any' for METRIC).

parameters.name: glucoseUnit
parameters.description: Default glucose unit on website (which doesn't affect API); one of (en_US, en_GB, 'any' for METRIC).

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description: The timezone in the format 'America/Los_Angeles'.

parameters.name: foodsLocale
parameters.description: The food database locale in the format of xx.XX.

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: The locale of the website (country/language); one of the locales, currently  (en_US, fr_FR, de_DE, es_ES, en_GB, en_AU, en_NZ, ja_JP).

parameters.name: localeLang
parameters.description: The Language in the format 'xx'. You should specify either locale or both - localeLang and localeCountry (locale is higher priority).

parameters.name: localeCountry
parameters.description: The Country in the format 'xx'. You should specify either locale or both - localeLang and localeCountry (locale is higher priority).

parameters.name: startDayOfWeek
parameters.description: The Start day of the week, meaning what day the week should start on. Either Sunday or Monday.

201.description: Returned if a new subscription was created in response to your request.

409.description: Returned if the given user is already subscribed to this stream using a different subscription ID, OR if the given subscription ID is already used to identify a subscription to a different stream.

scopes.activity: Activity data and exercise log related features, such as steps, distance, calories burned, and active minutes
scopes.heartrate: Continuous heart rate data and related analysis
scopes.nutrition: Calorie consumption and nutrition related features, such as food/water logging, goals, and plans
scopes.settings: User account and device settings, such as alarms
scopes.sleep: Sleep logs and related sleep analysis
scopes.social: Friend-related features, such as friend list, invitations, and leaderboard
scopes.weight: Weight and related information, such as body mass index, body fat percentage, and goals
